frame.name: Appointing
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Selector</fen>, often an individual in a leadership role, appoints a <fen>Official</fen> to assume an official <fen>Role</fen> in an organization (which can be expressed as the <fen>Body</fen>).
<ex><fex name="Selector">Press secretaries</fex> <t>accredit</t> <fex name="Official">journalists</fex> <fex name="Body">to the sessions</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Selector
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Selector</fen> is responsible for the appointment of the new official. Typically, it occurs as the External Argument of verbs.</def-root>

FE.name: Official
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Official</fen> is a person appointed to a recognized position.</def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition: <def-root>Frequently, the <fen>Official</fen> is referred to only by his/her role. However, the <fen>Role</fen> can be expressed separately from the leader, usually as either a secondary predicate or in a PP Complement (headed by <m>as</m>).</def-root>

FE.name: Function
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Function</fen> is the purpose the <fen>Official</fen> will fufill.
<ex>Under the new program, SCC will <t>accredit</t> organizations <fex name="Function">to assess wood flow from certified forests to workshops or factories</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Body
FE.definition: <def-root>A group of individuals who are elected or appointed to perform some function, and to which the <fen>Official</fen> is assigned.</def-root>
